definition: to double/to increase by a certain number of times
to turn over/to flip over/to overturn/to rummage through/to translate/to decode/to double/to climb over or into/to cross
foreign (non-Chinese)/barbarian/classifier for occurrences (of an event, action or speech utterance)/classifier for iterations: times, -fold (as in twofold etc)/classifier for situations: kind, sort

sentences.english: This year it expects to double its sales.
sentences.chinese: 它希望本年度這一數字能翻番。

sentences.english: In the past three years, pecan prices have doubled.
sentences.chinese: 在過去的三年裏，核桃價格已經翻番。

sentences.english: China's Daye to double refined copper output by 2015.
sentences.chinese: 預計2015年，中國大冶公司精煉銅產量翻番。

sentences.english: Cuz I stayed in school, selling candy so my money doubled .
sentences.chinese: 因爲我呆在學校，賣糖果所以我的錢翻番了。

sentences.english: The new e-bikes can easily double that range.
sentences.chinese: 使用新型的電動自行車可以輕鬆將這一里程翻番。

sentences.english: The amateur buys calls and sits back to watch his money double.
sentences.chinese: 業餘選手可以買看漲期權，並坐等自己的資金翻番。

sentences.english: Media industry output doubled in five yrs.
sentences.chinese: 傳媒業產值五年內將翻番。

sentences.english: Several important commodities like oil and copper have doubled from the bottoms this year.
sentences.chinese: 部分重要商品的價格如石油和銅已從今年的低位翻番。

sentences.english: wasn't interested in doubling my money, but in his saying that Burlington was going up.
sentences.chinese: 我對使我的錢翻番並不感興趣，但他說伯靈頓會漲。

definition: achievement/accomplishment/(in more recent usage) performance (of a business, employee etc)/results
